cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles SSW of Acapulco, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west to west-northwest for the next two days, then forecast to turn north and track parallel to the Baja California peninsula toward the central Baja coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California peninsula (near Cabo San Lucas)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Pacific coast from Guerrero to Jalisco and the Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late in the 5-day period; otherwise breezy coastal winds only.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected – system remains well south of the Southern California bight.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Kay could bring light to moderate showers to Southern California late week, but widespread 4-inch totals are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period south-southwest swells beginning late week may produce higher surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal erosion along San Diego beaches.
